item.title: Trump Hosts Kennedy Center Honors
item.description: President Trump hosted the Kennedy Center Honors on Sunday, recognizing artists for lifetime achievements. Trump, who appointed himself chairman of the center, became the first president to host the ceremony.
item.dc:creator: Shawn Paik
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

media:content.media:credit: Valerie Plesch for The New York Times

item.title: Qué significa ‘scurry’
item.description: Esta palabra ha aparecido en 37 artículos en NYTimes.com en el último año. ¿Puedes usarla en una frase?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Word of the Day: scurry
item.description: This word has appeared in 37 articles on NYTimes.com in the past year. Can you use it in a sentence?
item.dc:creator: The Learning Network

item.title: Thailand Launches Airstrikes on Cambodia in New Wave of Violence
item.description: Each side accused the other of firing first. The fighting came weeks after President Trump had cast himself as a peacemaker in the decades-old border dispute.
item.dc:creator: Sui-Lee Wee and Muktita Suhartono

media:content.media:credit: Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: The fighting ignited panic among civilians in both countries. Some people in Cambodia’s Preah Vihear province moved away from the border on Monday.

item.title: ‘The End of an Era,’ and 7 Other Things to Watch on TV This Week
item.description: The first two episodes of Taylor Swift’s documentary series air, and “South Park” wraps up its 28th season.
item.dc:creator: Shivani Gonzalez

media:content.media:credit: Lindsey Wasson/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Taylor Swift during the Eras Tour, which wrapped up in Vancouver last year.

item.title: Firefighter Is Killed as Multiple Wildfires Burn in Australia
item.description: The firefighter died after being struck by a tree. Dozens of homes in two states have been lost as hot, windy conditions point to a challenging fire season.
item.dc:creator: Victoria Kim

media:content.media:credit: Dan Himbrechts/Australian Associated Press, via Reuters
media:content.media:description: Firefighters at work in Koolewong in the Australian state of New South Wales on Saturday.

item.title: 8 Matisse Works Stolen From Library in Brazil
item.description: Two armed men stole over a dozen pieces of art from a São Paulo exhibition featuring works by the French painter and other artists.
item.dc:creator: Jin Yu Young

media:content.media:credit: Nelson Almeida/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: A police car in front of the Mario de Andrade Library in São Paulo, Brazil, on Sunday.

item.title: No Corrections: Dec. 8, 2025
item.description: No corrections appeared in print on Monday, Dec. 8, 2025.

item.title: United Nations Cuts Its 2026 Emergency Aid Budget in Half
item.description: Huge reductions in foreign aid by the United States and Europe have led the U.N.’s emergency relief coordinator to slash its fund-raising targets for next year.
item.dc:creator: Nick Cumming-Bruce

media:content.media:credit: Jeenah Moon/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Tom Fletcher, the United Nations under secretary general for humanitarian affairs, said U.N. agencies have been “under attack” as the United States and Europe have reduced the amount of international aid they give.

item.title: Quote of the Day: Teenagers Question Australia’s Social Media Ban
item.description: Quotation of the Day for Monday, December 8, 2025.

item.title: Dogs in Kimonos: Japan Reinvents a Children’s Holiday With Pets in Mind
item.description: A traditional Japanese festival is being adapted for poodles and Pomeranians, amid a booming pet industry and a dearth of children.
item.dc:creator: Javier C. Hernández, Hisako Ueno and Kentaro Takahashi

media:content.media:credit: Kentaro Takahashi for The New York Times

item.title: He Was a Russian Activist in Exile. His Own Wife Accused Him of Spying.
item.description: Poland has charged a little-known Russian opposition figure with espionage and participating in a bomb plot. His friends are perplexed.
item.dc:creator: Nataliya Vasilyeva

media:content.media:credit: via Danila Buzanov
media:content.media:description: Igor Rogov in the Polish Parliament building.

item.title: China’s Weak Currency Is Powering Its Exports and Drawing Criticism
item.description: China’s renminbi is lagging the currencies of key trading partners, making Chinese goods and services cheap and helping to drive exports.
item.dc:creator: Keith Bradsher

media:content.media:credit: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: An advertisement for a Xiaomi 17 Pro phone next to an Apple store in Shanghai. The weak value of the Chinese currency has hurt the ability of Chinese consumers to afford foreign brands.

item.title: China’s Trade Surplus Climbs Past $1 Trillion for First Time
item.description: President Trump’s tariffs weren’t enough to hold back the global export flood by China, which pushed past last year’s record in just 11 months.
item.dc:creator: Keith Bradsher

media:content.media:credit: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: A Geely manufacturing plant in Hangzhou, China. Carmakers and other exporters in traditional manufacturing powerhouses like Germany, Japan and South Korea are losing customers to Chinese rivals.

item.title: Congress Gears Up to Pass $900 Billion Defense Policy Bill
item.description: Lawmakers aim to send the bill, which authorizes $8 billion more than the White House requested, to the president’s desk by the end of the year.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Tierney L. Cross for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Mike Rogers, Republican of Alabama, at a hearing earlier this year. Mr. Rogers, the House Armed Services Committee chairman, said he was eager to send the legislation to President Trump’s desk.

item.title: ‘It: Welcome to Derry’ Season 1, Episode 7 Recap: Inferno
item.description: The town experiences a tragedy of new proportions. The lead perpetrator this time isn’t Pennywise.
item.dc:creator: Austin Considine

item.title: U.S. Deports Second Planeload of Iranians, Officials Say
item.description: The plane, carrying about 50 Iranians and other deportees, took off from Arizona on Sunday, under a deal the Trump administration reached with Iran two months ago.
item.dc:creator: Farnaz Fassihi

media:content.media:credit: Vahid Salemi/Associated Press
media:content.media:description: Tehran on Sunday. The identities of the Iranians being deported from the United States, and their individual circumstances, were not immediately clear.

item.title: Hundreds Rally for Boy, 6, Who Was Separated From His Father by ICE
item.description: “Taking children from their families is not normal,” a speaker told the crowd in Queens, where Yuanxin Zheng attended school until being detained.
item.dc:creator: Ed Shanahan and Stella Raine Chu

media:content.media:credit: Janice Chung for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: “We’re not going to let ICE or Donald Trump or anyone else separate us or divide us from each other,” Brad Lander, the New York City comptroller, said at a protest in support of 6-year-old Yuanxin Zheng.

item.title: NYT Crossword Answers for Dec. 8, 2025
item.description: Get into Dan Kammann and Zhouqin Burnikel’s crossword.
item.dc:creator: Sam Corbin

item.title: They Witness Deaths on the Tracks and Then Struggle to Get Help
item.description: After train operators are involved in fatal strikes, the agency that runs New York City’s subway often leaves them to fend for themselves.
item.dc:creator: Jonah Markowitz, Bianca Pallaro and Ana Ley

media:content.media:credit: Jonah Markowitz for The New York Times

item.title: Trump Blasts Henry Cuellar, Democrat Lawmaker, for Not Switching Parties After Pardon
item.description: Days after pardoning him, President Trump accused Representative Henry Cuellar of Texas of disloyalty for not switching to the Republican Party.
item.dc:creator: Anushka Patil

media:content.media:credit: Kenny Holston/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Henry Cuellar, who received a pardon from President Trump, is running for re-election as a Democrat.

item.title: I Hit the Art Basel Superfecta
item.description: But what was the payout? A critic survives the four-season journey to the premium art fair in Hong Kong, Basel, Paris and now Miami Beach. Here are his takeaways.
item.dc:creator: Jason Farago

media:content.media:credit: Sean Zanni/Patrick McMullan via Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Jesús Rafael Soto’s ‘‘Pénétrable’’ installation, made of suspended plastic or metal tubes, at the preview on Dec. 3 of Art Basel Miami Beach.

item.title: Lo que Trump realmente está haciendo con sus ataques a embarcaciones
item.description: Debemos cuestionar la legalidad de los ataques. Pero también tenemos que ver cómo encajan en el esfuerzo más amplio del gobierno de Trump por cambiar Estados Unidos.
item.dc:creator: Phil Klay
item.category: US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )

item.title: Immigration Agents Target Family of Deported College Student
item.description: The father of Any Lucía Belloza López said agents appeared at his home in Austin, Texas, on Sunday. His daughter, 19, was deported to Honduras during a surprise trip home for Thanksgiving.
item.dc:creator: Annie Correal

media:content.media:credit: Francis López
media:content.media:description: Any Lucía López Belloza celebrating her high school graduation in Texas.

item.title: The New Syria
item.description: The country certainly still faces many challenges. But some things are now going right there — and those are worth our attention, too.
item.dc:creator: Katrin Bennhold

media:content.media:credit: David Guttenfelder/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Celebrating one year after the fall of Bashar al-Assad in Hama, Syria, on Friday.

item.title: Trump Hosts the Kennedy Center Honors, Breaking Tradition
item.description: Past presidents have attended the marquee event, but on Sunday Mr. Trump was the first to host it, putting his cultural takeover of Washington in sharp relief.
item.dc:creator: Julia Jacobs
item.category: Kennedy, John F, Center for the Performing Arts

media:content.media:credit: Valerie Plesch for The New York Times

item.title: Democrats Call for Releasing Video of Deadly Boat Strike in the Caribbean
item.description: Top Democratic lawmakers who have seen the footage said Sunday that making the video public would provide transparency around the strikes that killed two survivors on Sept. 2.
item.dc:creator: Megan Mineiro
item.category: US Strikes on Alleged Drug Traffickers (2025- )
United States Defense and Military Forces

media:content.media:credit: Haiyun Jiang for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Representative Jim Himes said that the two survivors “were barely alive, much less engaging in hostilities.”

item.title: Islamic State Camps Pose a Dangerous Problem for Syria’s Leaders
item.description: The government faces a dilemma over what to do with civil-war-era prisons and detention camps that hold thousands of ISIS fighters and tens of thousands of their family members.

media:content.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak/The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Al Hol, a detention camp in northeastern Syria, holds family members of ISIS fighters.

item.title: Fern Michaels, Prolific Author of Romance Novels, Dies at 92
item.description: In her 40s, the self-described New Jersey housewife started building a women’s fiction empire, churning out dozens of popular books.
item.dc:creator: Alex Williams

item.title: Leak Highlights Poor State of Louvre Infrastructure
item.description: Up to 400 documents have been damaged by the leak, according to Francis Steinbock, the deputy administrator of the museum. But no works of art were affected.
item.dc:creator: Ségolène Le Stradic

media:content.media:credit: Julie Sebadelha/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
media:content.media:description: Francis Steinbock, the deputy administrator of the Louvre, said that documents had been damaged in a leak from a water pipe in the library of the Egyptian antiquities department.

item.title: Esta rutina de 20 minutos te dará fuerza para las tareas cotidianas
item.description: Practicar estos ejercicios puede hacer que los movimientos del día a día te resulten más cómodos.
item.dc:creator: Alyssa Ages and Theodore Tae

media:content.media:credit: Theodore Tae/The New York Times

item.title: En Honduras, algunos votantes se dejaron persuadir por Trump, otros se enfadaron
item.description: El presidente Trump apoyó a Nasry Asfura días antes de las elecciones del 30 de noviembre y denunció a sus oponentes. En una contienda reñida, eso ha inclinado potencialmente la balanza.
item.dc:creator: James Wagner and Jeff Ernst

media:content.media:credit: Federico Rios para The New York Times
media:content.media:description: El centro de Tegucigalpa, la capital hondureña, el sábado.

item.title: Katy Perry Posts Photos With Justin Trudeau Amid Romance Rumors
item.description: Ms. Perry and Mr. Trudeau, the former prime minister of Canada, posed together in photos and videos on Instagram, making them “Instagram official.”
item.dc:creator: Amanda Holpuch

media:content.media:credit: Jordan Strauss/Invision, via Associated Press, Miguel a Lopes, via EPA, via Shutterstock

item.title: At Alvin Ailey, a Caribbean Folk Tale Inspires a Dance About Love
item.description: The first week of the company’s annual season at City Center featured “Jazz Island,” an earnest premiere by Maija García, and a treasure by Alonzo King.
item.dc:creator: Gia Kourlas

media:content.media:credit: Kylie Cooper/Reuters
media:content.media:description: Coral Dolphin dances the role of Erzulie, the goddess of love, a central figure in Afro-Caribbean folklore and in Maija García’s “Jazz Island” by Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater.

item.title: Harris Reed: Why Maximalism Is a Necessity for Self-Discovery and Unfiltered Vulnerability in a Digital Age
item.description: Quiet luxury is in the past, and being loud is now.
item.dc:creator: Harris Reed

media:content.media:credit: Andrew Kelly/Reuters
media:content.media:description: From left, Demi Moore and Harris Reed at the 2024 Met Gala, an annual fund-raiser for the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s Costume Institute in New York City. The gown that Reed designed for Moore featured vintage archival wallpaper and hand embroidery.

item.title: Bessent Says He Divested From Soybean Farms After Ethics Office Warning
item.description: The Treasury Secretary said on Sunday he recently shed his holdings to comply with his federal ethics agreement.

media:content.media:credit: Tim Gruber for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: China stopped buying American soybeans in response to President Trump’s tariffs, inflicting economic pain on U.S. farmers.

item.title: Russian Drone Strike on Chernobyl Hasn’t Led to Rise in Radiation Levels
item.description: Despite the finding, the authorities have been unable to fix the damage from a drone that punctured Reactor No. 4’s outermost protective shield in February.
item.dc:creator: Kim Barker

media:content.media:credit: Brendan Hoffman for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Emergency workers outside the Chernobyl nuclear power plant in February after the confinement structure was punctured by a Russian drone in Pripyat, Ukraine.

item.title: The Education of Higher Education
item.description: As political pressure mounts and campuses face new cultural and financial strains, higher education confronts a test of purpose and survival.

item.title: Martin Parr, Who Photographed Britain’s Unvarnished Quirks, Dies at 73
item.description: Mr. Parr trademarked a hyperrealism in his photography that illuminated the “craziness of the English,” making small details loom larger than life.
item.dc:creator: Ali Watkins

media:content.media:credit: Dolly Faibyshev for The New York Times
media:content.media:description: Martin Parr at a gala at the American Museum of Natural History in New York in 2023.

item.title: Marcel Dzama: Don’t Ignore Truth
item.description: Artwork can challenge us to imagine what happens when society abandons reason and ignores truth.
item.dc:creator: Marcel Dzama

media:content.media:credit: Courtesy of Marcel Dzama and David Zwirner
media:content.media:description: Marcel Dzama’s drawing “The Sleep of Truth” (2025). The artwork, which features mythical animals watching a sleeping woman, explores the vulnerability of society shutting its eyes to truth and reason.

item.title: Is Hollywood Getting God?
item.description: Movies and pop stars wrestled with faith in 2025. That may be changing culture.
item.dc:creator: Lauren Jackson
